docs.title: Agent: Tellurian – The Protector
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

Before a hit would be assigned:

You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.

docs.title: Commander: Tungstantus – The Gardener
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 5 structures on the game board.

When 1 or more of your units use Production:

You may gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Hero: Ul the Progenitor - Elysium's Core
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Geoform: Awakening

Action:

Ready Elysium and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains the Space Cannon 5 (x3) ability as if it were a unit.

docs.title: Slumberstate Computing
docs.text:
When Coalescence results in a ground combat, if you commit no other units, you may choose for your units to coexist instead. During the status phase, for each player you are coexisting with, you and that player each draw 1 additional action card.

Other players may allow you to place a sleeper token on a planet they control.

⇋

docs.title: Titans of Ul – Terraform
docs.text:
Action: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex.

Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1 and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (Cultural, Hazardous, and Industrial).

docs.title: Last Bastion
docs.text:
"There is no sacrifice I would not make to see this through. No choice but forward, no option but victory. Go. We will handle this."

—Lyra Keen, Shield of the Reef

docs.title: Ordinian
docs.text:
| | Nebula

The Nekro virus consumed this former Naaz-Rokha colony virutally down to its bedrock. Restoration efforts have only begun to restore its ravaged biosphere.

docs.title: 4X41D "Hyperion" VI
docs.text:
You may exhaust this card when you pass to draw 1 action card and gain 1 command token.

A shard of a greater whole, a part of a grand effort.

docs.title: Revelation
docs.text:
| | Space Station

Hanging like a cathedral above Ordinian, the space station Revelation was constructed practically overnight to serve as the Last Bastion's military and economic hub.

docs.title: Starting Technologies
docs.text: Choose 1 blue or 1 yellow technology with no prerequisites

docs.title: Liberate
docs.text: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

docs.title: Galvanize
docs.text: When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit, they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one. Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities.

docs.title: Phoenix Standard
docs.text: At the end of combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

docs.title: The Egeiro
docs.text:
Unit Type: Flagship

Apply +1 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls for each non-home system that contains a planet you control.

  • Sustain Damage
  • Production 1

| Cost 8 | Combat 9 | Move 1 | Capacity 3 |

docs.title: A3 Valiance
docs.text:
Unit Type: Mech

When this unit is destroyed, if it was galvanized, galvanize up to 3 of your infantry in its system.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: 4X41C "Helios" V1
docs.text:
Unit Type: Space Dock

This unit's Production value is equal to 2 more than the resource value of this planet.

The resource value of this planet is increased by 1.

Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

  • Production X+2

Upgrade:

docs.title: 4X41C "Helios" V2
docs.text:
Requirements:

Unit Type: Space Dock

This unit's Production value is equal to 4 more than the resource value of this planet.

The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.

Up to 3 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

  • Production X+4

docs.title: Proxima Targeting VI
docs.text:
Requirements:

Cancel 1 hit produced by Bombardment rolls made against your ground forces for each of your galvanized units present.

At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve Bombardment 8 (x3) against your opponent's ground forces; if you do, make an identical roll against your own ground forces.

docs.title: Agent: Dame Briar – Bastion Valiant
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

When a player's unit is destroyed:

You may exhaust this card to galvanize another of that player's units in the destroyed unit's system.

Briar marveled at the sheer size of the Seraph. The technology was incredible. The Icon had truly given them something amazing. Still. Something about it was...off. Sometimes, as she walked the corridors of Revelation at night, she could not help but feel a familiar sense of dread.

docs.title: Commander: Nip and Tuck – Children of Ordinian
docs.text:
Unlock: There are 3 galvanized units on the game board

Your action cards cannot be canceled by "Sabotage" action cards.

The Nekro Virus cannot place assimilator tokens on your components.

Ainip felt the surge of energy through the Eidolon as it interfaced with Helios. He gasped. Absolute synergy achieved. Incredible!

docs.title: Hero: Lyra Keen – Shield of the Reef
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Entity 4X41A "Apollo": Intelligence Unshackled

When one of your galvanized units is destroyed: you may purge this card to roll 1 die for each unit in its system that belongs to another player; if the result is equal to or greater than the galvanized unit's combat value, destroy that unit.

Icon floated above Lyra's right shoulder, quiet, as if lost in thought. After a time, it responded. "I can do it. But you may die during the process." Lyra nodded. "It will be worth the risk."

docs.title: The Icon
docs.text:
When you produce ships, you may exhaust this card to place those ships in a system that contains 1 of your command tokens, at least 1 of your ground forces, and no other player's ships.

⇋

docs.title: Last Bastion – Raise the Standard
docs.text:
At the end of a combat:

Galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

Then, return this card to the Last Bastion player.

docs.title: Deepwrought Scholarate
docs.text:
~Together~sing~one~together~

~sing~deep~together~ends~suffering~

~life~triumphs~death~

—Aello, Kieros

docs.title: Ikatena
docs.text:
|

With over a million small islands and shallow, warm seas, Ikatena is considered a paradise by many species. Its recent Mahact occupation has left the once-peaceful planet scarred, but resolute.

docs.title: Starting Technologies
docs.text: During setup, research technology twice

docs.title: Research Team
docs.text: When ground forces are committed, if your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

docs.title: Oceanbound
docs.text:
When your units begin coexisting on a planet, gain an ocean card and ready it. Any time you have more oceans cards than there are planets that contain your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not.

Ocean Cards

docs.title: Brine Pool
docs.text: Sites with unique oceanic chemistry are of obvious interest to Deepwrought Researchers.

docs.title: Coral Reef
docs.text: Coral-analogues have evolved on many worlds, and their "reefs" are always areas of intense biodiversity.

docs.title: Deep Abyss
docs.text: The Abyssal zone features such dramatic pressure that even most Hylar need assistance to survive in the lightless depths.

docs.title: Ice Shelf
docs.text: Drylanders frequently discount the scientific opportunities to be found beneath their own polar ice sheets.

docs.title: Lost Fleet
docs.text: Although usually badly degraded by water and time, shipwrecks remain fascinating areas of exploration and study, whether those ships sailed sea or stars.

docs.title: D.W.S. Luminous
docs.text:
Unit Type: Flagship

This ship can move through systems that contain your units, even if other players' units are present; if it would, apply +1 to its move value for each of those systems.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 7 | Move 1 | Capacity 6 |

docs.title: Eanautic
docs.text:
Unit Type: Mech

When another player activates this system, if this unit is coexisting, you may move it and any of your infantry on its planet to a planet you control in your home system.

  • Sustain Damage
  • Production 1

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Hydrothermal Mining
docs.text:
Requirements:

At the start of the status phase, gain 1 trade good for each ocean card in play.

docs.title: Radical Advancement
docs.text:
Requirements:

At the start of the status phase, you may replace one of your non-unit upgrade technologies with a technology of the same color that has exactly 1 more prerequisite.

docs.title: Agent: Doctor Carrina – Oceanographer
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

When another player researches a technology:

You may exhaust this card to allow that player to ignore 1 prerequisite; if they do, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements into coexistance on a non-home planet they control.

"So many charts...fascinating." Ruthenia peered at Carrina's workspace through the tiny display. Several small aquariums lined each wall. "There is one problem though," she stated, raising her metallic shoulders in a sheepish shrug. "I'm rather heavy, you see. I can't swim..."

docs.title: Commander: Aello – Ikaten Kieros
docs.text:
Unlock: Have an ocean card in play.

When another player spends resources to research a technology:

That player may reduce the cost by 1; if they do, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

The Kieros were joyful and peace-loving—the Hylar reserved and calculating. Aello sought to bridge the gap between them, one verse, one lyric at a time.

docs.title: Hero: Ta Zern – Scholarate Founder
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Wave Function Collapse: The Laws Unwritten

Action: Purge this card and a non-unit upgrade technology you own or from your deck; then, purge all cards with the same name owned by other players and in other players' decks.

Then, each player that purged a technology they owned researches another technology.

Ikatena was not Ta Zern's home. It was not the home of any Hylar, for that matter. But it represented a shift. A change for his people. A necessary one, if they were to survive this new age.

docs.title: Visionaria Select
docs.text:
Action: Exhaust this card to allow each other player to spend 3 trade goods and give you 1 promissory note. Each player that does may research a non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology. You also gain each technology researched in this way.

⇋

docs.title: Deepwrought Scholarate – Share Knowledge
docs.text:
Action: Place this card faceup in your play area and gain 1 non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology that the Deepwrought player owns; place that technology on this card.

Return that technology to the deck and this card to the Deepwrought player at the end of the status phase.

docs.title: The Firmament / The Obsidian
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: The Firmament
docs.text:
"Asking 'who should rule us?' is overlooking a more important question: 'why have rulers at all?'"

—Sharsiss of Druaa

docs.title: The Obsidian
docs.text:
"This is the nightmare scenario. Case midnight omega. Mayday mayday mayday."

—Keleres Agent Niall, final report

docs.title: Commodities: 3
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Cronos
docs.text:
|

Although they spend most of their time working in the deep mines, the people of Cronos revere their beautiful sky. Its dense clouds cannot quite hide the luminous rings that shine every night.

docs.title: Tallin
docs.text:
|

Tallin's two oceans never intermix, completely separated by its main continent. They have unique chemical compositions and distinct biospheres.

docs.title: Cronos Hollow
docs.text:
|

The night sky is a deep black, unbroken by any star. During the day, the clouds are an unvarying gunmetal grey.

docs.title: Tallin Hollow
docs.text:
|

The oceans lie as dead as the hearts of the populace.

docs.title: Starting Technologies
docs.text: Choose 1 green or 1 yellow technology with no prerequisites

docs.title: Faction Abilities
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Plots Within Plots
docs.text: You can score secret objectives already scored by other players if you fulfill their requirements; this does not count against your secret objective limit or the number you can score in a round. When you score another player's secret objective, do not gain a victory point; instead, place a facedown plot card into your play area with that player's control token on it.

docs.title: Puppets of the Blade
docs.text:
If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability:

Action: Purge The Firmament's faction sheet, leaders, planet cards, and promissory note. Then, gain all the faction components for The Obsidian.

docs.title: Nocturne
docs.text: This faction cannot be chosen during setup.

docs.title: The Blade's Orchestra
docs.text: When this faction comes into play, flip your home system, double-sided faction components, and all of your in-play plot cards. Then, ready Cronos Hollow and Tallin Hollow.

docs.title: Marionettes
docs.text: The player or players whose control tokens are on each plot card are the puppeted players for that plot.

docs.title: Assail
docs.text: Apply +1 to the results of each of your combat and unit ability rolls against the puppeted player.

docs.title: Enervate
docs.text: You can perform the secondary ability of the puppeted player's strategy cards without spending command tokens; for "Leadership," you can perform the primary ability instead.

docs.title: Extract
docs.text:
When this card is revealed, gain 1 non-faction technology owned by the puppeted player.

When the puppeted player gains a non-faction technology, you may spend 4 resources to gain that technology.

docs.title: Seethe
docs.text:
When this card is revealed, destroy all units on a non-home planet controlled by a puppeted player.

At the start of the status phase, destroy 1 of the puppeted player's infantry in any system.

docs.title: Siphon
docs.text: When the puppeted player gains commodities, you gain an equal number of trade goods.

docs.title: Flagship
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Heaven's Eye
docs.text:
Unit Type: Flagship

If the active system contains units that belong to a player who has a control token on 1 of your plots, apply +1 to this ship's move value and repair it at the end of every combat round.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 5 | Move 1 | Capacity 3 |

docs.title: Heaven's Hollow
docs.text:
Unit Type: Decayed Flagship

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 5 | Move 1 | Capacity 3 |

docs.title: Mech
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Viper EX-23
docs.text:
Unit Type: Mech

When ground forces are committed to this planet, you may choose for your units to coexist, if they were not already. Flip this card if your faction becomes the Obsidian.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Viper Hollow
docs.text:
Unit Type: Decayed Mech

If this unit was coexisting when this card flipped to this side, gain control of its planet; the other player's units are now coexisting.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Faction Technologies
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Planesplitter
docs.text:
Requirements:

When you gain this card, put The Fracture into play.

Flip this card if the Obsidian faction is in play.

docs.title: Neural Parasite
docs.text:
Requirements:

At the start of the status phase, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on a planet you control in your home system.

Flip this card if the Obsidian faction is in play.

docs.title: Planesplitter
docs.text:
At the start of your strategic actions, you may move an ingress token into a system that contains or is adjacent to your units.

This technology cannot be researched.

docs.title: Neural Parasite
docs.text:
At the start of your turn, destroy 1 of another player's infantry in or adjacent to a system that contains your infantry.

This technology cannot be researched.

docs.title: Leaders
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: Agent: Myru Vos – The Hungry Shadow
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

When a player moves ships:

You may exhaust this card; if you do Space Cannon cannot be used against those ships. If they are not transporting units, they can also move through other players' ships.

Vos's ship passed undetected through the Collective's fleet. The fools. So reliant on their "visions" and their "Nefishh" that they failed to see what was directly under their noses.

docs.title: Commander: Captain Aroz – The Black Flag
docs.text:
Unlock: Have a plot card in play.

You may treat planets in systems that contain your ships as if you controlled them for the purpose of scoring secret objectives.

Resolute in the Firmament, the Black Flag flies.

docs.title: Hero: Sharsiss – The Coiling Void
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

The Blade Beckons: Knife in the Back

Action: Place one of your plot cards in play with any other player's control token on it. Then, you may place any player's control token on 1 of your in-play plot cards; one plot cannot have two of the same player's tokens.

Then, purge this card.

Sharsiss turned the point toward himself and plunged the splintered Obsidian into his own chest. It glittered. Sharsiss smiled.

docs.title: Agent: Vos Hollow – Hunger Burning
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

When a player's ship is destroyed during any combat:

You may exhaust this card; if you do that player's opponent must destroy 1 of their ships of the same type in the active system.

Vos was gone. Nothing remained. He was not trapped; he was not changed; he was not made lesser. He was simply gone. Only a singular, primal hunger remained. The Dragon's hunger, seeking, seeping into every vein and every scar. And it burned.

docs.title: Commander: Aroz Hollow – Standard Broken
docs.text:
Unlock: Have units in The Fracture.

Apply +1 to the result of each of your units' combat rolls in The Fracture.

Shattered, tattered, the broken dreams of empire fallen.

docs.title: Hero: Sharsiss Hollow – Sanity Snapped
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

The Blade Revealed: Eternity's End

Action: Ready all of your planets

Then, purge this card.

The Dragons strikes, and the stricken seethe. Hollow minds, hollow means. The splinter seeks to free the whole. Hollow lies, hollow freed.

docs.title: Breakthrough
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: The Sowing
docs.text:
When you gain this card and at the start of the status phase, you may place up to 3 of your trade goods on this card.

Flip this card if you become the Obsidian faction.

⇋

docs.title: The Reaping
docs.text:
Place 1 trade good from the supply onto this card each time you win a combat against a puppeted player.

At the start of the status phase, gain all trade goods on this card, then gain an equal number of trade goods from the supply.

⇋

docs.title: Faction Promissory Note
docs.text: FirmamentObsidian

docs.title: The Firmament – Black Ops
docs.text:
When you receive this card, if you are not the Firmament:

The Firmament player may place 1 facedown plot card in their play area with your control token on it. Then, gain 2 command tokens, gain 2 trade goods, and purge this card.

docs.title: The Obsidian – Malevolency
docs.text:
At the end of one of your tactical actions:

Spend 1 influence to give this card to one of your neighbors; you can use this ability even if you are the Obsidian player.

At the end of the status phase, if you are not the Obsidian player, remove 1 command token from your fleet pool and return it to your reinforcements.

docs.title: Council Keleres
docs.text:
"Our duty is to protect the billions of people in our galaxy, not the few hundred in these Council Chambers."

—Tribunii Harka Leeds

docs.title: Commodities: 2
docs.text: Mentak TribuniiXxcha TribuniiArgent Tribunii

docs.title: Moll Primus
docs.text: | <$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

docs.title: Starting Technologies
docs.text: Choose 2 non-faction technologies owned by other players.

docs.title: The Tribunii Ω
docs.text: During setup, choose a Keleres hero that corresponds to an unused faction; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control tokens. The unchosen Keleres heroes are not used.

docs.title: Council Patronage
docs.text: Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Law's Order Ω
docs.text: You may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity at the start of any player's turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of that turn.

docs.title: Artemiris
docs.text:
Unit Type: Flagship

Other players must spend 2 influence to activate this system.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 7 | Move 1 | Capacity 6 |

docs.title: Omniopiares
docs.text:
Unit Type: Mech

Other players must spend 1 influence to commit ground forces to this planet.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Executive Order
docs.text:
Requirements:

Action: Exhaust this card and draw the top or bottom card of the agenda deck. Players immediately vote on this agenda as if you were the speaker; you can spend trade goods and resources on this agenda as if they were votes.

docs.title: Agency Supply Network
docs.text:
Requirements:

Once per action, when you resolve a unit's Production abilities, you may resolve another of your unit's Production abilities in any system.

docs.title: Agent: Xander Alexin Victori III – Miracle Worker
docs.text:
Unlock: Always Unlocked

At any time:

You may exhaust this card to allow any player to spend commodities as if they were trade goods.

"It's honestly incredible, the way he manages to stretch a couple aurei. To find money where there is none. The man could fund an army at the same cost you or I might get lunch. Terrifying, really."

–Suffi An

docs.title: Commander: Suffi An – Working Multiple Angles
docs.text:
Unlock: Spend 1 trade good after you play an action card that has a component action.

After you perform a component action:

You may perform an additional action.

Suffi looked over the contracts. "So I get paid twice...once each by two different contractors...for doing the same job? What's the catch?"

Mentak TribuniiXxcha TribuniiArgent Tribunii

docs.title: Hero: Harka Leeds – Keleres Tribunii
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Available if you chose the Mentak during setup.

docs.title: Erwan's Covenant: The Winds of Change
docs.text:
Action: Reveal cards from the action card deck until you reveal 3 action cards that have component actions. Draw those cards and shuffle the rest back into the action card deck.

Then, purge this card.

Authority. Strength. Efficacy.

docs.title: Hero: Odlynn Myrr – Keleres Tribunii
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Available if you chose the Xxcha during setup.

docs.title: Operation Archon: Witching Hour
docs.text:
After an agenda is revealed:

You may cast up to 6 additional votes on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. For each player that abstains or votes for another outcome, gain 1 trade good and 1 command token.

Then, purge this card.

Peace. Community. Deterrence.

docs.title: Hero: Kuuasi Aun Jalatai – Keleres Tribunii
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Available if you chose the Argent Flight during setup.

docs.title: Overwing Zeta: Artemiris Ascendant
docs.text:
At the start of a round of of space combat in a system that contains a planet you control:

Place your flagship and any combination of 2 cruisers or destroyers from your reinforcements in the active system.

Then, purge this card.

Valor. Grace. Wisdom.

docs.title: I.I.H.Q. Modernization
docs.text:
When you gain this card, gain the Custodia Vigilia planet card and its legendary planet ability card.

You are neighbors with all players that have units or control planets in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.

⇋

docs.title: Custodia Vigilia
docs.text:
|

Custodia Vigilia. The fully realized seat of the Keleres. A veritable fortress in the heart of Mecatol City. Ten thousand people come and go daily, and the Keleres see them all.

docs.title: Legendary Text
docs.text:
While you control Mecatol Rex, it gains Space Cannon 5 and Production 3.

Gain 2 command tokens when another player gains a victory point using the second clause of "Imperial."

Pax magnifica, bellum gloriosum.

docs.title: Council Keleres – Keleres Rider
docs.text:
After an agenda is revealed:

You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.

Then, return this card to the Keleres player.

docs.title: Ral Nel Consortium
docs.text:
"The great web of obligation binds us all as surely as gravity. Those who would cheat us would cheat the galaxy of its right to exist."

—Actuary General "Watchful" Ojz

docs.title: Mez Lo Orz Fei Zsha
docs.text:
|

The great cities of Mez Lo Orz Fei Zsha cover most of the surface in their concentric, well-organized rings. Each city is owned and operated by its own massive corporate-consortium.

docs.title: Rep Lo Orz Qet
docs.text:
|

Arid and desloate except along its equatorial sea, the Ral Nel birth world has escaped the worst depredations of industrialization. The cities along the coast balance modern amenities with natural beauty.

docs.title: Starting Technologies

"Yes sir, yes sir! From Jord to Elysium in the shortest time and insured to boot. Your parcels are par-ticularly safe with us! No hassle, no worry! Just a one-time very reasonable shipment fee, convenience fee, regional tax, insurance premium...oh and a pittance just in case we have to pay of the Coalition..."

When you delcare a retreat:

Immediately retreat up to 2 of your ships from the active system to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Place a command token from your reinforcements into that system.

Ojz opened one eye. Had he fallen asleep? Perhaps. Perhaps...

docs.title: Hero: Director Nel – Acquisitive Mind
docs.text:
Unlock: Have 3 scored objectives.

Signal Intrusion: Limit Break

After the last player passes:

You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

He was the master, the king. There were no limits to Nel's ambition. No rules to be broken, no obstacles to be avoided. Only choice. A matrix of pure, unfettered futures.

—Ahk-Syl Siven

The mysterious world discovered by the Crimson Rebellion is just as impossible in physical space as its sister planet, Creuss. Initially uninhabited, the world has begun to foster life—of a sort.

They could remember who they had been before the thieving. They could recall the duration as well, mostly. But it was all so far away. Disconnected, almost unreal. Like a copied copy whose authenticity had degraded with each successive replica. Freedom had not come paired with hope.

docs.text:

Apply +1 to the Move value of this ship if it would transport 4 units.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 3 | Move 2 | Capacity 4 |

docs.title: Colada
docs.text:
Unit Type: Tempered Mech

While this unit is being transported, choose 1 unit in its system that has a Capacity value to roll 1 additional die on its combat rolls.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Paradox – Il Na Viroset
docs.text:
Comply, puppets! Hearken to our desires, die at our command!

Commodities: 4

docs.title: Enigma
docs.text:
Unit Type: Paradox Flagship

This unit ignores the effects of all anomalies. Its Move value is reduced by 1 for each unit it would transport.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 7 | Combat 7 | Move 7 | Capacity 7 |

docs.title: Starlancer XI
docs.text:
Unit Type: Paradox Mech

This unit participates in space combat as if it were a ship. For each anomaly this unit is in or adjacent to, apply +1 to this unit's combat rolls.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Replicant – El Nel Janovet
docs.text:
Your perspective is limited. Limit is flaw. Join us. Embrace perfection.

Commodities: 3

docs.title: The Faces of Janovet
docs.text:
Unit Type: Replicant Flagship

This unit gains the unit abilities and text abilities of your destroyer, cruiser, and dreadnought unit upgrade technologies.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 8 | Combat 5 | Move 1 | Capacity 3 |

docs.title: Analyzer
docs.text:
Unit Type: Replicant Mech

After you win a ground combat in which this unit participated, you may return this unit to your reinforcements to draw 1 unit upgrade.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 6 |

docs.title: Raithborn – A Sickening Lurch
docs.text:
"A revolting display. To gain a crown, it sold its soul to demons that are beneath our contempt. I move that we strike its name from the rolls and destroy its kingdom."

— Jae Mir Kan, last words

Commodities: 2

docs.title: A Strangled Whisper
docs.text:
Unit Type: Raithborn Flagship

This ship can transport any number of infantry and fighters, and they do not count against this ship's capacity.

  • Sustain Damage
  • Bombardment 7

| Cost 8 | Combat 7 | Move 1 | Capacity 1 |

docs.title: Bone Picked Clean
docs.text:
Unit Type: Raithborn Mech

When you splice, capture 1 infantry from the reinforcements of any player with adjacent units; you can spend 1 captured infantry after rolling during combat to reroll this unit's dice.

  • Sustain Damage

| Cost 2 | Combat 5 |

docs.title: Overgrowth
docs.text:
Arborec Paradigm

Action: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain 1 or more of your ground forces.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Flock Migration
docs.text:
Argent Paradigm

Action: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other players' ships.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Intelligence Unshackled
docs.text:
Bastion Paradigm

When one of your units is destroyed:

You may purge this card to designate that unit as the catalyst; roll 1 die for each other player's unit in the system. For each result equal to or greater than the catalyst's combat value, destroy that unit.

docs.title: Event Horizon
docs.text:
Vuil'Raith Paradigm

Action: Each other player rolls a die for each of their non-fighter ships that are in or adjacent to a system that contains a gravity rift; on a 1–5, return that unit to their reinforcments.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Changing the Ways
docs.text:
Creuss Paradigm

Action: Swap the positions of any 2 non-Fracture systems that contain wormholes or your units, other than the Creuss system, the Ahk Creuxx system, or the wormhole nexus.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: The Laws Unwritten
docs.text:
Deepwrought Paradigm

Action: Purge an ability owned by any player.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Opening the Eye
docs.text:
Empyrean Paradigm

Action: Place 1 frontier token in each system that does not contain any planets and does not already have a frontier token. Then, explore each frontier token that is in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Sanction of the Quieron
docs.text:
Hacan Paradigm

Action: Resolve the Production abilities of your units in your home system. You may reduce the cost of each of your units to 0 during this use of Production.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Brilliance of the Hylar
docs.text:
Jol-Nar Paradigm

Action: Draw 1 genome, 1 unit upgrade, and 1 ability.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Artemiris Ascendant
docs.text:
Keleres Paradigm

At the start of a round of space combat in a system that contains a planet you control:

Place your flagship and any combination of up to 2 cruisers or destroyers from your reinforcements into the active system.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: The Winds of Change
docs.text:
Keleres Paradigm

Action: Reveal cards from the action card deck until you reveal 3 action cards that have component actions. Draw those cards and shuffle the rest back into the action card deck.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Witching Hour
docs.text:
Keleres Paradigm

Action: Choose a player other than the current speaker to gain the speaker token.

Choose a player other than the tyrant to gain the benediction token.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Diaspora
docs.text:
L1Z1X Paradigm

Action: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Void Transferrence
docs.text:
Letnev Paradigm

Action: Place this card near the game board; the number of non-fighter ships you can have in systems is not limited by the number of command tokens in your fleet pool during this game round.

At the end of that game round, purge this card.

docs.title: Gravitational Collapse
docs.text:
Muaat Paradigm

After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex:

You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.

docs.title: Insurrection
docs.text:
<$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

Mentak Paradigm

At the start of a space combat that you are participating in:

You may purge this card; if you do, for each other player's ship that is destroyed during this combat, place 1 ship of that type from your reinforcements in the active system.

docs.title: Forge Legend
docs.text:
Naaz-Rokha Paradigm

Action: Gain 1 relic and 2 command tokens.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Poison of the Nefishh
docs.text:
Naalu Paradigm

At the end of the status phase:

You may choose an ability owned by another player; they must either give you that ability or give you 2 other abilities. If you do, purge this card.

docs.title: Devour World
docs.text:
Nekro Paradigm

Action: Choose a planet that has a technology specialty in a system that contains your units. Destroy any other player's units on that planet. Gain trade goods equal to that planet's combined resource and influence values and draw 1 ability.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Time Warp
docs.text:
Echoing Paradigm

Action: Place this card near the game board; your flagship and units it transports can move out of systems that contain your command tokens during this game round.

At the end of that game round, purge this card.

docs.title: Brood Swarm
docs.text:
N'orr Paradigm

After you move ships into the active system:

You may skip directly to the "Commit Ground Forces" step; if you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements.

docs.title: Eternity's End
docs.text:
Obsidian Paradigm

Action: Search the ability, unit upgrade, or genome deck for any card and gain it.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Limit Break
docs.text:
Ral Nel Paradigm

When the last player passes:

You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

docs.title: Dimensional Reflection
docs.text:
Rebellion Paradigm

When you produce ships:

You may place any of those ships onto this card.

At the start of combat, you may purge this card to place all ships from this card into the active system.

docs.title: The Lay of Lisis
docs.text:
Saar Paradigm

Action: Choose 1 system that is adjacent to 1 of your space docks. Destroy all other players' infantry and fighters in that system.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Twilight Directive
docs.text:
Federation Paradigm

Action: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Awakening
docs.text:
Titan Paradigm

Action: Ready a planet you control and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains the Space Cannon 5 (x3) ability as if it were a unit.

+ | Space Cannon 5 (x3) | +

docs.title: Sins of the Father
docs.text:
Winnu Paradigm

Action: Perform the primary ability of any strategy card. Then, choose any number of other players. Those players may perform the secondary ability of that strategy card.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Voice of the Council
docs.text:
Xxcha Paradigm

Action: Reveal 3 edicts; choose 1 to resolve and shuffle the rest back into the edict deck.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Blessing of the Yin
docs.text:
Yin Paradigm

Action: Commit up to 3 infantry from your reinforcements to any non-home planets and resolve ground combats on those planets; players cannot use Space Cannon against these units.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Extortion
docs.text:
Yssrail Paradigm

Action: Each other player shows you 1 action card from their hand. For each player, you may either take that card or force that player to discard 3 random action cards from their hand.

Then, purge this card.

docs.title: Twilight's Fall Rules
docs.text: Coming soon.

docs.title: Strategy Cards
docs.text:
• Lux

    Primary:

    • Gain 3 command tokens.
    • Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

    Secondary:

    • Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.

  • Noctis

    Primary:

    • Initiate a genome splice.
    • Ready up to 2 planets.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to participate in the genome splice.

  • Tyrannus

    Primary:

    • Choose a player other than the speaker. That player gains the speaker token.
    • Choose a player other than the speaker or tyrant. That player gains the benediction token.
    • Draw 2 action cards.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 2 action cards.

  • Civitas

    Primary:

    • Either place 1 structure on a planet you control, or use the Production ability of 1 of your space docks.
    • Place 1 structure on a planet you control.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 structure on a planet you control.

  • Amicus

    Primary:

    • Gain 3 trade goods.
    • Replenish commodities.
    • Choose any number of other players. Those players use the secondary ability of this strategy card without spending a command token.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to replenish your commodities.

  • Calamitas

    Primary:

    • Initiate a unit upgrade splice.
    • Resolve the Production abilities of your units in 1 system.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 4 resources to either participate in the unit upgrade splice or use the Production abilities of the units in your home system.

  • Magus

    Primary:

    • Initiate an ability splice. You may spend 3 resources and 3 influence to add 1 additional ability to the pool; if you do, after each player has chosen, it passes back to you and you take an additional ability.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 3 resources or 3 influence to participate in the ability splice.

  • Aeterna

    Primary:

    • Immediately score 1 public objective if you fulfill its requirements; otherwise draw 1 paradigm.
    • Gain 1 victory point if you control Mecatol Rex; otherwise, draw 1 secret objective.

    Secondary:

    • Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 1 secret objective or 1 paradigm.

docs.title: Bioplasmosis
docs.text:
At the end of the status phase:

You may remove any number of ground forces from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

docs.title: Mitosis
docs.text:
At the start of the status phase:

Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

docs.title: Stymie
docs.text:
After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units:

You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.

docs.title: Aerie Hololattice
docs.text:
Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.

Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the Production 1 ability as if it were a unit.

docs.title: Raid Formation
docs.text:
When 1 or more of your units uses Anti-Fighter Barrage:

For each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has Sustain Damage to become damaged.

docs.title: Zealous
docs.text:
When 1 or more of your units roll dice for a unit ability:

You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.

docs.title: Bio-Synthetic Sуnergу
docs.text:
Your action cards cannot be canceled by "Shatter" action cards.

Your other abilities cannot be taken, purged, or discarded by other players and cannot have singularity tokens placed on them.

docs.title: Liberate
docs.text:
When you gain control of a planet:

Ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

docs.title: Proxima Targeting VI
docs.text:
Cancel 1 hit produced by each Bombardment roll against your units.

At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve Bombardment 7 (x3) against your opponet's ground forces; if you do, resolve Bombardment 7 (x3) agianst your own ground forces.

docs.title: Amalgamation
docs.text:
Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.

When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

docs.title: Crucible
docs.text: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead.

docs.title: Dimensional Tear
docs.text:
Systems that contain your structures are also gravity rifts; your ships do not roll for these gravity rifts.

Place a dimensional tear token beneath your space docks as a reminder.

docs.title: Dimensional Splicer
docs.text:
At the start of a space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships:

You may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

docs.title: Quantum Entanglement
docs.text: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

docs.title: Slipstream
docs.text:
During your tactical actions:

Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in a system that contains a wormhole.

docs.title: Genetic Research
docs.text:
At the start of the status phase:

Choose a technology color and gain trade goods equal to the number of abilities you own that have that technology color.

docs.title: Pacifist
docs.text:
When ground forces are committed:

If your units on that planet are not already coexisting, you may choose for your units to coexist.

docs.title: Radical Advancement
docs.text:
At the start of the status phase:

You may choose to replace 1 of your abilities; if you do, reveal abilities from the deck until you reveal another ability with the same technology color and gain it; shuffle the replaced technology and the other revealed cards back into your deck.

docs.title: Aetherstream
docs.text:
After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly:

You may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action

docs.title: Overwatch
docs.text:
After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 of your command tokens:

You may return that token to your reinforcements.

docs.title: Voidborn
docs.text:
Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

You can allow players to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

docs.title: Guild Ships
docs.text:
You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

You can exchange action cards with other players as part of transactions.

docs.title: Quantum Datahub Node
docs.text:
At the end of the strategy phase:

You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of their strategy cards.

docs.title: Sled Factories
docs.text:
When 1 or more of your units use Production:

Reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.

docs.title: E-Res Siphons
docs.text:
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:

Gain 4 trade goods.

docs.title: Spatial Conduit Cylinder
docs.text:
After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your units:

That system is adjacent to all other systems that contain 1 or more of your units during this action.

docs.title: Tactical Brilliance
docs.text:
After you roll dice for a unit ability:

You may reroll any of those dice.

docs.title: Agency Supply Network
docs.text:
Once per action, when you resolve one a unit's Production ability:

You may resolve another of your unit's Production abilities in any system.

docs.title: Fleet Logistics
docs.text: During each of your turns of the action phase, you may perform 2 actions instead of 1.

docs.title: Puppet Council
docs.text:
At the start of the strategy phase:

Replenish your commodities, then gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Assimilate
docs.text:
When you gain control of a planet:

Replace each structure on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

docs.title: Harrow
docs.text:
At the end of each round of ground combat:

Your ships in the active system may use their Bombardment abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

docs.title: Inheritance Systems
docs.text:
During the status phase:

Draw 1 additional action card and gain 1 additional command token.

docs.title: Armada
docs.text: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

docs.title: Munitions Reserves
docs.text:
At the start of each round of space combat:

You may spend 2 trade goods; you may re-roll any number of your dice during that combat round.

docs.title: Non-Euclidean Shielding
docs.text:
When 1 of your units uses Sustain Damage:

Cancel 2 hits instead of 1.

docs.title: Ambush
docs.text:
<$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

At the start of a space combat:

You may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

docs.title: Mirror Computing
docs.text:
<$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

When you spend trade goods:

Each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

docs.title: Pillage
docs.text:
<$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction:

If they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

docs.title: Magmus Reactor
docs.text:
Your units can move into and through supernovas.

Each supernova that does not contain other players' units and each system that contains 1 or more of your war suns gains Production 5 as if it were one of your units.

docs.title: Star Forge
docs.text: Action: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

docs.title: Stellar Genesis
docs.text:
After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

You may gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Foresight
docs.text:
After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:

You may place 1 command token from your reinforcements in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

docs.title: Neuroglaive
docs.text:
After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:

That player removes 1 token from their fleet pool and returns it to their reinforcements.

docs.title: Telepathic
docs.text:
At the end of the strategy phase:

Place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

This card cannot have a singularity token placed on it.

docs.title: Distant Suns
docs.text: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs: You may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

docs.title: Fabrication
docs.text:
Action:

Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

docs.title: Supercharge
docs.text:
Before making a combat roll:

Choose 1 of your units and apply +2 to the result of its combat roll.

docs.title: Singularity X
docs.text:
Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity X" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

docs.title: Singularity Y
docs.text:
Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity Y" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

docs.title: Singularity Z
docs.text:
Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed:

You may place the "Singularity Z" token on one of your opponent's abilities. While that token is on a card, this card gains that card's text. You cannot place a singularity token on a card that already has a singularity token.

docs.title: Future Path
docs.text:
When you gain trade goods from choosing a previously unchosen strategy card or from the "Amicus" strategy card:

Triple those trade goods.

docs.title: Quantum Drive
docs.text: You can produce your flagship without spending resources.

docs.title: Temporal Command Suite
docs.text:
After any player's genome becomes exhausted:

You may spend 3 influence to ready that genome; if you ready another player's genome you may perform a transaction with that player.

docs.title: Unrelenting
docs.text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

docs.title: Valkyrie Particle Weave
docs.text:
After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat:

If your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

docs.title: Valkyrie Vanguard
docs.text:
During the "Commit Ground Forces" step:

You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.

docs.title: Neural Parasite
docs.text: At the start of your turn: Destroy 1 of another player's infantry in or adjacent to a system that contains your infantry.

docs.title: Planesplitter
docs.text:
When you gain this card, put the Fracture into play.

Apply +1 to the Move value to each of your ships that starts its movement in The Fracture.

Apply +2 to the result of each of your units' combat rolls in The Fracture.

docs.title: The Burning Eye
docs.text: You can treat planets in systems that contain your ships as if you controlled them for the purpose of scoring secret objectives.

docs.title: Courier Tranport
docs.text: After you activate a system: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens onto planets you control in the active system.

docs.title: Nanomachines
docs.text:
Action: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control.

Action: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units.

Action: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

docs.title: Survival Instinct
docs.text:
After a player activates a system that contains your ships:

You may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens.

docs.title: Entropic Harvest
docs.text:
At the end of any player's combat:

Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

docs.title: Smothering Presence
docs.text: Other players units in or adjacent to systems that contain your structures lose all of their unit abilities.

docs.title: Subatomic Splicer
docs.text:
When one of your ships is destroyed:

You may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

docs.title: Chaos Mapping
docs.text:
At the start of your turn in the action phase:

You may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has Production.

docs.title: Nomadic
docs.text:
You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.

docs.title: Scavenge
docs.text:
After you gain control of a planet:

Gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Orbital Drop
docs.text: Action: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

docs.title: Spec Ops Training
docs.text:
After 1 of your ground forces are destroyed:

Roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

docs.title: Versatile
docs.text:
When you gain command tokens during the status phase:

Gain 1 additional command token.

docs.title: Abundance
docs.text: When 1 or more of your units use Production, you may gain 1 trade good.

docs.title: Awaken
docs.text: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your infantry, you may replace 1 of those infantry with a PDS from your reinforcements.

docs.title: Terraform
docs.text: Planets that contain your structures are treated as having all 3 planet traits (cultural, hazardous, and industrial).

docs.title: Hegemonic Trade Policy
docs.text:
When 1 or more of your units use Production:

You may swap the resource and influence values of 1 planet you control during this use of Production.

docs.title: Lazax Gate Folding
docs.text:
During your tactical actions:

Treat systems that contain legendary planets you do not control as if they contain both an alpha and beta wormhole.

docs.title: Reclamation
docs.text:
After you resolve an action during which you gained control of a legendary planet:

You may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on that planet.

docs.title: Instinct Training
docs.text:
When another player plays an action card:

You may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to cancel that action card.

docs.title: Nullification Field
docs.text:
When another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships:

You may exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to immediately end that player's turn.

docs.title: Peace Accords
docs.text:
After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

You may gain control of 1 planet that does not contain the custodians token or any units and is adjacent to a planet you control.

docs.title: Devotion
docs.text:
After each space combat round:

You may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

docs.title: Indoctrination
docs.text:
At the start of a ground combat:

You may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

docs.title: Yin Ascendant
docs.text:
When you score an objective:

Draw 1 genome, ability, or unit upgrade.

docs.title: Crafty
docs.text:
You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

During your turn of the action phase, players that have passed cannot play action cards.

docs.title: Scheming
docs.text:
When you draw 1 or more action cards:

Draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

docs.title: Stall Tactics
docs.text:
Action:

Discard 1 action card from your hand.

docs.title: Pacific Genome
docs.text:
Abundance

Action: Exhaust this card and choose any player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with one from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship.

docs.title: Scornful Genome
docs.text:
Zeal

When a player produces ground forces in a system:

You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.

docs.title: Valiant Genome
docs.text:
Courage

After a player's unit is destroyed during combat:

You may exhaust this card to roll 1 die. If the result is equal to or greater than that unit's combat value, their opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their units.

docs.title: Ravenous Genome
docs.text:
Hunger

After another player replenishes commodities:

You may exhaust this card to convert their commodities to trade goods and capture 1 unit from their reinforcements that has a cost equal to or lower than their commodity value.

docs.title: Enigmatic Genome
docs.text:
Mystery

After a player activates a non-home system that contains a wormhole:

You may exhaust this card; if you do, that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain a wormhole during this tactical action.

docs.title: Research Genome
docs.text:
Erudition

When a player initiates a splice:

You may exhaust this card to add 3 additional cards to that splice.

docs.title: Cosmic Genome
docs.text:
Enlightenment

After a player moves ships into a system that does not contain any planets:

You may exhaust this card; that player gains 1 command token.

docs.title: Silver Genome
docs.text:
Prosperity

During the action phase:

You may exhaust this card to gain 2 commodities or replenish another player's commodities.

docs.title: Experimental Genome
docs.text:
Sacrifice

When a player spends resources:

You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove any number of their infantry from the game board. For each unit removed, reduce the resources spent by 1.

docs.title: Action Genome
docs.text:
Efficiency

At any time:

You may exhaust this card to allow any player to spend commodities as if they were trade goods.

docs.title: Brutal Genome
docs.text:
Severity

After a player activates a system:

You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.

docs.title: Aristocratic Genome
docs.text:
Dominance

At the start of a space combat round:

You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ship in the active system; that ship rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

docs.title: Hyper Genome
docs.text:
<$mentak_Image3" width="149px" height="141px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/> <$mentak_Image6" width="161px" height="153px" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64,"/>

Energy

At any time:

You may exhaust this card and choose another player; that player gives you 1 trade good, if able, then you each draw 1 action card.

docs.title: Molten Genome
docs.text:
Intensity

Action: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains one of their war suns or their flagship.

docs.title: Limit Genome
docs.text:
Unbound

After any player's command token is placed in a system:

You may exhaust this card to return that token to that player's reinforcements.

docs.title: Curious Genome
docs.text:
Perseverance

At the end of a player's turn:

You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.

docs.title: Recursive Genome
docs.text:
_ERROR_ERROR_ERROR_ERROR_

During the action phase:

You may exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may discard 1 action card or spend 1 command token from their command sheet to gain 2 trade goods.

docs.title: Investment Genome
docs.text:
Echo of Means

When you gain trade goods from the supply:

You may exhaust this card to place an equal number of trade goods on this card. When this card readies, gain the trade goods on this card.

docs.title: Temporal Genome
docs.text:
Echo of Time

After the "Roll Dice" step of combat:

You may exhaust this card. If you do, hits are not assigned to either player's units. Return to the start of this combat round's "Roll Dice" step.

docs.title: Deployment Genome
docs.text:
Echo of Conflict

At the end of a player's turn:

You may exhaust this card to allow that player to remove up to 2 of their ground forces from the game board and place them on planets they control in the active system.

docs.title: Swarm Genome
docs.text:
Fervor

At the end of a player's tactical action:

You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.

docs.title: Mirror Genome
docs.text:
Deception

When a player moves ships:

You may exhaust this card; if you do, Space Cannon cannot be used against those ships; if they are not transporting units, they can also move through other players' ships.

docs.title: Courier Genome
docs.text:
Reliability

Action: Exhaust this card to draw 2 action cards; give 1 of those cards to another player.

docs.title: Breach Genome
docs.text:
Instability

Action: Exhaust this card to choose 1 player. That player may swap the position of 2 of their ships in any systems; they may transport units when they swap.

docs.title: Captain's Genome
docs.text:
Momentum

After a player activates a system:

You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.

docs.title: Human Genome
docs.text:
Adaptability

At the start of a round of ground combat:

You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

docs.title: Altruistic Genome
docs.text:
Mettle

When a hit is produced against a unit:

You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.

docs.title: Divine Genome
docs.text:
Sovereignty

When 1 or more of a player's units use Production:

You may exhaust this card to reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 2.

docs.title: Diplomatic Genome
docs.text:
Serenity

Action: Exhaust this card to ready any planet; if that planet is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control, you may remove 1 infantry from that planet and return it to its reinforcements.

docs.title: Splitting Genome
docs.text:
Replication

After a player's destroyer or cruiser is destroyed:

You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place up to 2 fighters from their reinforcements in that unit's system.

docs.title: Clever Genome
docs.text:
Acuity

This card has the text ability of each other player's genomes, even if those genomes are exhausted.
